--**************************************************************************************
--* Description: Meter exchange "AX" exhchange process that exchanges an existing account with a new 
--*			account number and associate the existing meters with the new account number
--*
--* Exec:usp_ProcessExchangeCode_AX
--*
--* Parameter(s):
--* ExchangeSeqidint  - The sequence id of the exchange record to be processed
--* ExchangeCode varchar(2)- The exchange code of the exchange record to be processed,
--*								it should be a "AX" for this procedure.
--* BillingPeriod varchar(6) - Current billing period
--* UtilityCompanySeqid INT- The sequence id of the Utility Companyto be processed
--* StatusCode  INT output -  Execution Return Status 
--*
--* Database:  OEC
--*
--* Return:	  0 Success
--*  1 Failure
--*
--* AUTHOR: Peter Heller (PAH)
--* Created On:10/26/2005
--**************************************************************************************
--* DateTech Description of Change
--* ---------- ----  -------------------------------------------------------------
--* 10/26/2005 PAH  First Version  
--* 05/25/2014 PAH  Join the exchange and the account tables and find the old active account that is to be exchanged
--* 04/09/2019 VYModified for EnergySubTypeID
--***************************************************************************************
CREATE PROCEDURE [Nypa].[usp_ProcessExchangeCode_AX]
(
	@AuthenticatedUserID AS INT,
	@ExchangeSeqid AS INT,
	@XchangeCode AS VARCHAR(2),
	@CurrentBillingPeriod AS VARCHAR(6),
	@UtilityCompanySeqid AS INT,
	@CommitTransaction AS VARCHAR(1) OUTPUT,
	@StatusCode AS INT OUTPUT
)
AS
BEGIN
	DECLARE @UnknownAgencySeqid INT, @UnknownFacilitySeqid INT, @EnergyDeliveryTypeSeqid INT, @OldAccountSeqid INT
	,@CurrentAccountSeqid  INT, @BillingPeriod NVARCHAR(6), @CurrentAccountNumber NVARCHAR(15), @OriginalAccountNumber NVARCHAR(15)
	,@CurrentMeterNumber NVARCHAR(12), @OriginalMeterNumber NVARCHAR(12), @crlf varchar(2);

	SELECT @UnknownAgencySeqid = 396, @UnknownFacilitySeqid = 4623, @EnergyDeliveryTypeSeqid = 1, @crlf = CHAR(13) + CHAR(10);

	IF (@XchangeCode = 'AX')
	BEGIN
		BEGIN TRY
			SELECT @CommitTransaction = 'Y', @StatusCode  = 0;
			SELECT  
				@BillingPeriod = BillingPeriod, 
				@CurrentAccountNumber=CurrentAccountNumber, @OriginalAccountNumber=OriginalAccountNumber, 
				@CurrentMeterNumber=CurrentMeterNumber, @OriginalMeterNumber = OriginalMeterNumber 
			FROM Nypa.UploadNYPAExchangeData						
			WHERE UploadNYPAExchangeDataSeqid = @ExchangeSeqid;

			-- Join the exchange and the account tables and find the old account that is to be exchanged
			SELECT @OldAccountSeqid = A.AccountSeqid
			FROM Billing.Account AS A INNER JOIN
				Nypa.UploadNYPAExchangeData AS ED ON A.OriginalAccountNumber = ED.OriginalAccountNumber AND 
				A.CurrentAccountNumber = ED.OriginalAccountNumber
			WHERE ED.UploadNYPAExchangeDataSeqid = @ExchangeSeqid AND A.AccountStatus <> '28';

			-- Create New Account from the existing Account information and changing the account numbers 
			-- based upon the Exchange data.
			INSERT INTO Billing.Account
				(CurrentAccountNumber, OriginalAccountNumber,ExcessDistributionAssocEnergyAccount, IsExcessDistribution, CommodityAssocDeliveryAccount, IsCommodityAccount, UtilityAccountProvider, 
				AgencyAccount, FacilityAccount, ManualDataEntry, AccountStatus, AccountPreviousStatus, AccountStatusCodePeriod, CurrentInvoiceAccountGroup, 
				AccountEffectiveTurnOn, AccountEffectiveTurnOff, EnergySource, EnergyAccountDescription, 
				EnergyDeliverySubTypeId, /* added on 4/9/2019 */
				SalesType, DeliveryTariffRate, DeliveryTariffEffectiveDate, 
				CommodityTariffRate, CommodityTariffEffectiveDate, BillingCycle, Delivery, AccountInMultipleBuildings, SourceOfRevenue, TurnOnDate, TurnOffDate, 
				IsTimeOfDayAccount, MunicipalCode, Territory, Tension, TripNumber, PartSupplied, UtilityServiceAccountName, UtilityServiceAddress, Borough, Block, 
				LotNumber, CityPlanningBIN, ELOAgencyAddress, LastPeriodOriginalBilled, LastPeriodAdjustmentBilled,  
				AdjustmentRecordSeqid, Notes, AuthenticatedUserID, DateAdded, LastUpdate)
			SELECT 	ED.CurrentAccountNumber, ED.CurrentAccountNumber,
				A.ExcessDistributionAssocEnergyAccount, A.IsExcessDistribution, A.CommodityAssocDeliveryAccount, 
				A.IsCommodityAccount, A.UtilityAccountProvider, A.AgencyAccount, A.FacilityAccount, A.ManualDataEntry, 
				'AC', 'NX', ED.BillingPeriod, A.CurrentInvoiceAccountGroup, ED.AccountEffectiveTurnOn, 
				'99991231', -- ED.AccountEffectiveTurnOff, 
				A.EnergySource, A.EnergyAccountDescription, 
				A.EnergyDeliverySubTypeId, /* added on 4/9/2019 */
				A.SalesType, A.DeliveryTariffRate, A.DeliveryTariffEffectiveDate, A.CommodityTariffRate, 
				A.CommodityTariffEffectiveDate, A.BillingCycle, A.Delivery, A.AccountInMultipleBuildings, A.SourceOfRevenue, 
				A.TurnOnDate, A.TurnOffDate, A.IsTimeOfDayAccount, A.MunicipalCode, A.Territory, A.Tension, 
				A.TripNumber, A.PartSupplied, A.UtilityServiceAccountName, A.UtilityServiceAddress, A.Borough, A.Block, 
				A.LotNumber, A.CityPlanningBIN, A.ELOAgencyAddress, A.LastPeriodOriginalBilled, A.LastPeriodAdjustmentBilled, 
				A.AdjustmentRecordSeqid, A.Notes, ED.authenticatedUserID, getDate(), getDate()
			FROM Billing.Account AS A INNER JOIN Nypa.UploadNYPAExchangeData AS ED ON A.OriginalAccountNumber = ED.OriginalAccountNumber AND 
				A.CurrentAccountNumber = ED.OriginalAccountNumber
			WHERE ED.UploadNYPAExchangeDataSeqid = @ExchangeSeqid AND A.AccountSeqid = @OldAccountSeqid;
			
			-- Get the Current Account sequence id after it is inserted
			SELECT @CurrentAccountSeqid  = ident_current('Billing.Account');
			
			--	Find the account that is currently being exchanged update it with the 
			--	new CurrentAccountNumber.
			UPDATE Billing.Account
			SET
				CurrentAccountNumber = ED.CurrentAccountNumber,
				AccountEffectiveTurnOff  = ED.AccountEffectiveTurnOn,
				AccountPreviousStatus = A.AccountStatus, 
				AccountStatus = 'AX', 
				AccountStatusCodePeriod =  @CurrentBillingPeriod, 
				LastUpdate = getDate(),
				AuthenticatedUserID = @AuthenticatedUserID
			FROM Billing.Account AS A  INNER JOIN Nypa.UploadNYPAExchangeData AS ED 
				ON A.OriginalAccountNumber = ED.OriginalAccountNumber AND A.CurrentAccountNumber = ED.OriginalAccountNumber
			WHERE ED.UploadNYPAExchangeDataSeqid = @ExchangeSeqid AND A.AccountSeqid = @OldAccountSeqid;
			
			--	Find the remainder of accounts that were previously exchanged and update their
			--	CurrentAccountNumber with the newest replacement @CurrentAccountNumber
			UPDATE A
			SET A.CurrentAccountNumber = E.CurrentAccountNumber, LastUpdate = getDate(),
				A.AuthenticatedUserID = @AuthenticatedUserID
			FROM Billing.Account AS A INNER JOIN Nypa.UploadNYPAExchangeData AS E ON A.CurrentAccountNumber = E.OriginalAccountNumber
			WHERE A.UtilityAccountProvider = @UtilityCompanySeqid AND E.UploadNYPAExchangeDataSeqid = @ExchangeSeqid;

			--	Find all of the meters that were on the old account number
			--	and insert a an updated copy with the new CurrentAccountNumber and it's
			--	internal sequence id.
			INSERT INTO Billing.AccountExchangeMeterTrack
				(OriginalAccountSeqid, OriginalMeterSeqid, OriginalAccountNumber, OriginalMeterNumber, AuthenticatedUserID,
				UtilityCompanySeqid, OriginalAgencyDivisionSeqid, OriginalFacilitySeqid)
			SELECT @CurrentAccountSeqid, EM.OriginalMeterSeqid, ED.CurrentAccountNumber,
				EM.OriginalMeterNumber, @AuthenticatedUserID, EM.UtilityCompanySeqid, 
				EM.OriginalAgencyDivisionSeqid, EM.OriginalFacilitySeqid
			FROM Billing.AccountExchangeMeterTrack AS EM INNER JOIN Nypa.UploadNYPAExchangeData AS ED ON EM.OriginalAccountNumber = ED.OriginalAccountNumber
				AND EM.UtilityCompanySeqid = ED.UtilityCompanyId
			WHERE EM.OriginalAccountSeqid = @OldAccountSeqid AND ED.UploadNYPAExchangeDataSeqid = @ExchangeSeqid;
			
			UPDATE Nypa.UploadNYPAExchangeData
			SET IsProcessed = 'Y'
			WHERE UploadNYPAExchangeDataSeqid = @ExchangeSeqid;
		END TRY
		BEGIN CATCH
			DECLARE @ExchangeErrorMessage NVARCHAR(4000), @ErrorMessage NVARCHAR(4000), @ErrorSeverity INT
				,@ErrorState INT, @ErrorNumber INT, @ErrorLine INT, @ErrorProcedure NVARCHAR(126);
			
			SELECT @ExchangeErrorMessage ='Error in StoredProcedure %125s at line number %8.0d'+@crlf+'NYPA Billing Period: %6s'+@crlf+'Exchange Sequence Id:%4.0d'+@crlf+'Account Current:Original (%15s : %15s)  '+@crlf,
				@ErrorMessage = ERROR_MESSAGE(), @ErrorSeverity = ERROR_SEVERITY(), @ErrorState = ERROR_STATE(),
				@ErrorNumber = ERROR_NUMBER(), @ErrorProcedure = ERROR_PROCEDURE(), @ErrorLine = ERROR_LINE();			
				
			SET	@ErrorMessage = @ExchangeErrorMessage + @ErrorMessage+@crlf+'@ErrorNumber: '+cast(@ErrorNumber as varchar(10))+@crlf;

			RAISERROR(@ErrorMessage, @ErrorSeverity, @ErrorState, @ErrorProcedure, @ErrorLine, @BillingPeriod
				,@ExchangeSeqid, @CurrentAccountNumber, @OriginalAccountNumber) with log;
			
			SELECT @StatusCode  = 1, @CommitTransaction = 'N';
		END CATCH;
	END;
END;
